intro: Conobea innominata, commonly known as the ghost flower, is a flowering plant native to South America. It is characterized by its unique, pale violet to white flowers that resemble ghostly apparitions, hence its common name. The plant belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments and has hairy, lance-shaped leaves. Conobea innominata is valued for its ornamental beauty and is often cultivated in gardens for its ethereal appearance.
